args:
As feared, a horde of fiends was headed for
town, but it is defeated with the help of a man
named Ku Hai, who is searching for capable
warriors on behalf of the dragon Peng Lai.
Having been acknowledged by Ku Hai, the
party heads back to town under his guidance.
*pant* *pant* What a relief...\nThe town is still okay...
It looks like we were able to\nget here before the fiends.
Ya sure they're really comin'? We might\nbe gettin' all worked up over a big zero.
Are you saying that my calculations\nare incorrect, sir?!
No one is doubting you. Still, isn't it\nbetter that the fiends are NOT coming?
Just to be safe, we should talk to\nthe townsfolk and have them\nevacuate to some place more secure.
Er, perhaps it might be better NOT to let\nthe townspeople find out about this.
They deserve to know. Besides, keeping\nthem in the dark makes it harder for us\nto ensure their safety.
Why are you so averse to telling them\nwhat's going on here?
Everyone is so excited for the festival,\nand I don't want to throw cold water\non their happy mood.
Peng Lai is not a town of abundance,\nand there are a great many people\nwho leave the town to find work.
The Lunar New Year is the only time\nmost of those people return home.
So if we could get through this without\nthem finding out, I'd like to do so.\nEven if it means I must fight alone.
I am in agreement with Su Fang.
Me too! Festivals are only fun when\nthere are tons of people enjoying 'em,\nafter all.
I'm not going to let them fight this out\non their own; we'll stay and lend a hand.
All right then. If there are fiends headed\nfor town, let's track them down before\nthey can get here.
A horde of fiends! Just like Xiao Lei said.
Tch! You guys ain't so tough!
That idiot's wadin' right into the horde!
I've never seen such bladework!\nWho IS this man?
That is Ku Haiâ€”a legendary swordsman\nwho left Peng Lai to wander the world.
Don't mean nothin' to me, but if he's\nwillin' to punch chumps, I'm all for it!
...Okay, looks like the fiends are all gone.
And none of them made it close to town.\nLooks like we can relax for now at least.
Thank you all. ...And Ku Hai! How good\nto see you have returned!
It has been some time, Su Fang.\nThough it is not quite correct\nto say that I have returned.
A wanderer has no place to return to.\nNot even the town he once called home.
But were you not just fighting\nto protect that very town?
Even if I have let go of my homeland,\nI cannot forget my obligation to it.
Just be honest and say you wanted\nto protect your hometown, weirdo!
Easy, Notte. Anyone who lets go of their\nhomeland's got more than their fair share'a\ntroubles. Give the guy a break, yeah?
Su Fang, who are these warriors with you?
Travelers who lent their aid in order\nto protect the town.
We had a revelation in a dream.\nWe're saviors, baby!
A revelation?  Hmm, and you seem to be\nable warriors as well. Perhaps...
I would speak with you. However,\nlet us first collect ourselves in town.
Ku Hai! ...Er, I mean, if that is your wish,\nwe will return to Peng Lai for now.
Oh man, I haven't had a meat bun\nin FOREVER! *chomp* *munch*\nOh yeah, that's the stuff...
Nothing beats a Lunar New Year feast,\nam I right? Talk about great timing!
Lin You and Mao Mao have wasted no time\ngetting caught up in the festival spirit.
All the more reason to be thankful\nwe took care of those fiends.
Now then, what was it you needed\nto speak with us about, Ku Hai?
It is no accident that I find myself in\nPeng Lai; in my journeys, I met with\nPeng Lai, and he bade me do so.
Wait, isn't that the name of your town?

Peng Lai is a legendary dragon who
came from Taiwu alongside Xu Fu.
He is responsible for creating the
very foundation of the town.

It is said that one hundred years ago,
Peng Lai used his power to turn this
once-desolate land into the soil upon
which people now thrive.
Our ancestors named their village after\nhim in order to show their reverence.
So is the dragon IN the town?
Peng Lai is as a drifting cloud, never\nremaining in one place for long.
I happened upon Peng Lai in the midst of\nmy travels, and he informed me that crisis\nwas drawing near the town.
I know not about your dreams, but\nPeng Lai was worried about the drying\ndragon-vein spring.
Yes. However, Peng Lai is making efforts\nto ensure it does not come to pass.
He claimed he was headed for the spring,\nand charged me with seeking out any who\ncould be of help and taking them there.
He told you to do that? But...
I know, Su Fang. I'm hardly the best person\nto be seeking help from others.
Peng Lai found much amusement in this\nsituation. Honestly, he's as much chittering\nchild as venerable old dragon.
Nonetheless, I understand the situation.\nAnd if that's what he has asked of you,\nI will gladly come along.
And so will we. I think it might be why\nwe were called here in the first place.
You have my gratitude. Let us make\nfor the dragon-vein spring, then.
